required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study of CAR-iNKT Cells in the Treatment of Relapsed/Refractory/High-risk B-cell Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study of CAR-iNKT Cells in the Treatment of Relapsed/Refractory/High-risk B-cell Tumors

lead_sponsor.agency: Kai Lin Xu; Jun Nian Zheng

collaborator.agency: The First People's Hospital of Changzhou
First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the safety and feasibility of hCD19.IL15.CAR-iNKT cells in treating patients with relapsed/refractory/high-risk B-cell tumors.

detailed_description.textblock: CD19 CAR-T has been shown to treat a variety of refractory or recurrent B-cell tumors. Because most CAR-T cells are generated from the patient's own T cells and are individualized products, and there are individual differences between patients, the generation of customized CAR-T cells is an expensive and time-consuming process. Universal CAR- iNKT cells are an ideal product for cell therapy. In this study, we prepared universal iNKT cells expressing hCD19 CAR and IL-15 to treat refractory, relapsed, or high-risk B-cell tumors.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 28 days after T cell infusion
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events assessed according to NCI-CTCAE v5.0 criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: MRD negative overall response rate (MRD- ORR)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of MRD negative overall response rate (MRD- ORR) at 3 months of treatment
Assessment of ORR (ORR = CR + CRi ) at Month 6, 12, 18 and 24
Assessment of EFS at Month 6, 12, 18 and 24
Assessment of OS at Month 6, 12, 18 and 24

arm_group.description: Dose escalation follows the accelerated titration and the standard 3+3 dose escalation design. A total of 3 dose levels are set for subjects.

intervention.description: Universal hCD19.IL15.CAR-iNKT cells by a single infusion intravenously will be given in escalating doses.

overall_official.affiliation: The Affiliated Hospital of Xuzhou Medical University

facility.name: The Affiliated hospital of Xuzhou medical University

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Kai Lin Xu; Jun Nian Zheng
